reviews.review_msg: Hands down the best class I have ever taken. His lectures were easy to follow, and filled with slides of awesome dinosaurs. I mean really. DINOSAURS. He always wore a tie clip, and made lame jokes, but I loved him.
learned so much
all memorization, final was tough

She's an amazing lecturer and person, passionate about dinos and learning itself. Homework is just 10-20 mins per lecture, with participation activities and many bonus mark opportunities. She truly wants you to succeed. I got an A+ studying the day before exams, but I would say my memory is probably above average. Take that for what you will.

Best professor you'd ever have should you need to achieve Breadth-Science credit at SFU! 

Her lectures are very interesting, and all you need to do is invest 15+ hours a week when studying for the unit tests!
Cindy is super nice and fun. Though if you struggle with memorization at all this is a class you should 100% avoid.
Cindy is goated. She has very fun lectures, maybe one of the best profs I've had. Supppper heavy on memorization but she's an awesome teacher.

Tests are relatively straightforward (50 MCQ questions). I think the people who rated her low didn't really put in the effort to study the review questions and spend a little bit of time reading the lecture slides. She's very accessible with office hours and she posts lecture recordings if you missed class. 10/10, lovely dino enthusiast.
shes very cool and has lots of dinosaur models. lectures are fun and easy to keep up with. tests are all mc and are based on lecture slides, no additional readings required. rawr

Amazing prof, very kind and a good lecturer, definitely cares about what she is teaching. 
No exams, and tests weren't too hard (all multiple choice q's), but you pretty much have to memorize everything. That being said pretty much everything you need to know is on the lecture slides.
Definitely recommend this course.

Tough grader, don't take her classes for an easy A. You will need to HARD CORE MEMORIZE tiny details that seem irrelevant. She is super nice and has wide open office hours and will clarify concepts for you if you ask.

Chill professor. Class only has exams. Homework is easy if you go to lectures. Really interesting course if you love dinosaurs. However, there is a lot of memorization in this course (basically you have to memorize every point of each slide). She does give lots of extra credit though. No textbook required either. Just go to lecture and memorize.
She's lovely and the class is laid out well, but the amount of memory is frankly, absurd. There is no other way to demonstrate knowledge, except through pure memorization.

cindy was such a nice prof and super willing to help her students. i would recommend taking this as an elective! the unit tests were pretty memorizing heavy and you had to know alot of material but it was overall very straightforward :)

It's hard, but should be expected when taking a course in university, even if it is an 100-level course. Heavy on memorization, so if that's not your thing, this course may not be the best for you. However, the course is super interesting. No paper, gives bonuses to improve your mark, and provides resources to use. She WANTS you to do well.
Really helps with review of learning and is a very clear instructor, very easy to follow.

Cindy was an involved and thorough professor. She was super organized and took time to remember our names! She was a super approachable prof and had great lessons. Tests were super hard however and lengthy. However, I appreciate her opportunities to get bonus marks, see our tests, and boost our marks. Great prof!!!

Cindy was engaging and lively, and her passion and dedication brought out the best of the material. Tests were memorization-heavy, but you're provided with a plethora of diagrams, tools, and examples to assist with that. Honestly if you have the time to spare, why not take the dinosaur class?

Cindy is a nice prof but this class is not it. The tests are fair but it is pure memorization. You need to memorize every single small detail from the slides, so if you don't have a strong memory DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. This class is too hard for a 100-level elective.

I had a great experience with Cindy last fall! Before class ended we had to do a short assignment in groups which was fairly easy (participation marks) and there was a lot of homework, but it was super easy and could be done in 5 minutes. Tests were super easy and fair, just memorize the material.

Took this course in Fall 2023. The lectures were straightforward and didn't use the textbook (don't buy the textbook you won't need it). There are 4 labs and 4 tests which make up a majority of your grade plus daily worksheets which sounds like a lot of work (but keep in mind this class has no tutorial).
As long as you study, you should do fine.

I took this course as an elective and I thought it was very reasonable. Cindy is a very sweet and kind person. Make sure you really know the content because although the tests are very fair, they're very memory heavy

Cindy's tests are really fair, she explains everything about her lectures and nothing on the tests are outside of the lectures. So, if you annotate, STUDY and listen, then you will do well in the class. 50 mins for her tests are fair because you can get through the mc pretty quickly and have enough time to do the short answers.

This was the total opposite experience on what I was expecting for a first level course to dinos. For the most part, instead of testing us on info she emphasized in lectures like the key features of the dinos, she tested us on unimportant small details which made no sense to even test our learning on. These exams were a race against time. Um, no.

The tests are only 50 mins long and have 30 multiple choice and 15 short answer questions. I couldnt even finish the first 2 exams because of the time limit without even getting the chance to read some short answer questions. Only take this class if you have a photographic memory or already know A LOT about dinosaurs.

This class was delivered online through pre-recorded lectures. If you're okay with memorizing every small detail for a 50 minute exam, where you are expected to write very detailed written answers (grading is very tough) and multiple choice questions, this class will be for you.

I took this for a science credit and it was a mistake. This class seems straight forward but is difficult. In the 50 minute time slots for class, tests that have 35-45 questions are given; it is extremely stressful, sometimes you cant even finish the test. Unless you are super good at memorizing a ton of info, I would not recommend this class.

Dr. Hansen puts a lot care and effort into her teaching. All the material is laid out well and easy to understand. Make sure to take detailed notes during lectures, and if you put some effort into studying it is not hard to do well. Tests are very fair, though she is a tough marker on the few written answer questions. Accessible and great Prof!

Do not take EASC 103 with her. As an elective course, she expects a lot from students during her exams. You have to memorize everything to do well on the exams. Her lectures are really annoying as she is v/ wordy when explaining her slides. As well, she keeps repeating her points. Her class is such a waste of time.
Im highly recommend this course as b-sci. You literally just memorize the key point in the ppt, and no finals but three tests throughout the whole semester.

Cindy is an amazing prof! Her lectures are always fun and interesting, and I would definitely recommend taking EASC103, whether it's because you need a science credit or you just like dinosaurs. Of course you will need to study to do well (memorize the time periods the dinosaurs were around in!), but the tests are fair and Cindy is awesome!

Cindy is such a lovely person and more importantly, an AMAZING prof! She really knows how to teach people in a way that makes the information easy to understand, and sticks in your head. Her tests are fair, and test only whats on her slides, and she really emphasizes the points that she tests. Put in some effort, and you'll get a decent mark

This was an amazing class! I took it to fulfill my science credit and I was surprised by how fun it was. Lectures and slides are laid out very clearly which makes studying easy. Her labs and in-class activities are participation, not answer graded. This is a memorization class, but if you study early it's easy. She brings little dino toys to class.

This class is all about memorization and honestly if you go to most of the lectures and the labs, there are participation exercises every class to get easy points on, youll be fine. I honestly didnt study that great for tests and still got Bs. I also missed a few labs and lectures and ended up with a good grade. If you study an A is achievable.

Cindy Hansen is the best professor I have ever had and also best class I have ever taken!! She is the sweetest lady in the world and cares so deeply about her students and dinosaurs! Her tests are fair and as long as you study you should achieve a high mark! I also love the Dinos in the lab component she adds to this course!! They are super fun :)

This would be an easy class if you were good at memorization. The exams are not open book, but thankfully, the questions are mostly multiple choices, fill-in-the-blanks, connect-the-dots kind of questions. She is a kind person, and lectures are fun to hear since she is passionate about dinosaurs. You may learn new and interesting things from her.

she is a picky examiner. She bases your answers off of everyone else's, and not just whether your answer is somewhat right. So, write your answers very detailed! Attend every class for extra notes. Her slides are easy to understand, but there is  A LOT to memorize!

I took this class to fulfill my final elective requirement. Amongst all of the 100-200 level electives that I have taken I found this to be by far the most difficult. There is no analytical thinking involved, but you better be good at memorizing great swaths amount of information. I just wish Cindy would curve, as her grading is really strict.

This class is NOT a GPA Booster. Do not get fooled by her saying "I don't expect much as this class is not a required easc course." If you are looking for easy B-Sci course take something else. Her lecture is easy, but exams were very difficult. You need to work hard and memorize everything single details on her lecture slides. No textbook.

For a first year class, it is very difficult, and not only that the professor is very strict, she actually wouldn't accept my doctors note, because it would be an inconvienance for her, because she would have to give the exam again, her lectures are easy, but her exams are not

I loved this class, and Robbie always provided an informative and interesting lecture. Her tests were easy if you put in the work to study, and she is always available to answer any questions. I would totally take a class with her again.

great prof, the lectures were super interesting and well-explained. she gives lots of opportunities to get an A if you are willing to pay attention and study. attending class is definitely a must but worth it. would highly recommend this class

Did poorly on midterm because I didn't study, so studying is key! Lots of information given in this class, and Robbie does well at explaining. She's always willing to answer questions, but her tests and marking expectations could do with more clarification.

Don't be fooled because it looks like an easy credit. You need to attend every lecture and write down every word she says. There are questions on the exam that are, in my opinion, extremely unfair. (ex: "what is Robbie's favorite dinosaur" worth 550 marks of the exam... yes that's 10%)

She's a good prof that makes the lecture funny and interesting.  She provide great slides with many pictures of dinosaurs for you to see.  Her midterms and finals were kind of hard, but you would be allow to bring a cheat sheet.
Very nice prof!  Obviously enthusiastic.  Cares about students.  Make sure you go to lectures.  Plenty of dinosaur pictures =)
Her favourite dinosaurs are T.rex and pachyposaurids... that's why she's so cool.  Lecture slides are filled with pictures for our enjoyment.  Good video choices during lab.  Very fair marker.

ROBBIE REALLY KNOWS HER STUFF and is great at teaching, but as a result she's an extremely hard marker especially when it comes to labs...on tests ur allowed cheat sheets/lab books BUT unless you know this course inside out (and seriously, who has the time) how well you do depends on how well you luck out with the answers on your cheat sheet.
Great prof! makes dinosaurs come alive through labs and lectures. Not an easy marker, definitely have to put some effort in her lab assignments and exams are not easy.
Too much stuff to remember during the exams, thank god for the cheat sheets! Follow the marking criteria carefully and you'll get full marks.
A very good speaker, makes learning about dinosaurs super fun. Also very patient about putting up with annoying people who interupt her lectures. Very easy going and friendly!
Some people should not teach. And loose the curly mullet.

Excellent prof in every way. Expectations clearly defined. Notes online prior to lecture and fill in the blanks during lecture. Interesting subject matter makes you look at life in a new way. There are a lot of assignments, but if you do the work according to her instructions there's no reason not to get an A in this course.
Waste your time elsewhere.
Robbie is the best prof I've seen. She replies e-mail fast and she helps you at almost everything.

Very very good prof. Easy going and very interested in dinosaurs. She makes ESC 103 one of the few FUN courses at SFU. Final was not very hard nor was the midterm. Last but not least she has a sense of humour!
Hmmmm how to describe the worst class in the world? Oh well what can I expect taking a course in University about dinosaurs.
Material was quite simple, material was explained well in lectures, but why have a lab if you're only going to show discovery channel videos?
Disturbing lack of organisation. Little preparation for her final lectures. Tests were a little bizarre. Not an enjoyable time but she seemed to have fun.
Terrible lecturer.  Terrible marker.  Didn't even cover the last half of the course.  Should not be teaching at all.
tests unlike anything found in lectures
funny, helpful, friendly
way too much material. who can memorize all that crap while taking 5 other classes?
boring lectures, way too much material, it's only a good class to take if you're not taking anything else and can focus 110%
I photocopied lecture notes an inch thick. i **** you not. WAY too much content.
She is a really great instructor who is always willing to help students.
